038eb7b4-52e0-430a-9476-5c3bb21d0066.description: OCPA Voting Members display knowledge and expertise, encourage and promote the role of paralegals, and provide a network of support and a local voice for paralegals within OCPA and the paralegal field. Joining OCPA gives members access to several benefits to help advance their careers. These benefits include an online platform to grow knowledge and skills; a subscription to OCPA's quarterly publication, The Compendium; access to OCPA MCLE events; online job searches; and more.
038eb7b4-52e0-430a-9476-5c3bb21d0066.name: OCPA Voting Member

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Only Voting Members shall be "Members" as defined in Section 5056 of the California Corporations Code. Voting Members have the right to vote on all matters brought before the membership of OCPA, and have the right to hold office within the Association.

A Voting Member is a paralegal who meets the definition of California Business & Professions Code Section 6450 et seq. and Article III, Section 3 of the Association's bylaws, who resides or is employed in California, and who has worked as a paralegal for at least the six months previous to the date on his/her membership application.
OCPA memberships must be renewed annually.

9973f339-25ef-4f89-bc7d-741872a4908a.description: OCPA held its 36th annual Educational Conference, "Power to the Paralegal": 45 Years Strong on September 10, 2022. Attendees networked with legal professionals and received MCLE on topics such as "Diversity in the Legal Profession", Contract Drafting Techniques, Immigration/Family Law, E-discovery, Anatomy of a Trademark Infringement Trial, Civil Litigation Success Building your Case for the Best Outcome, Corporate Law Merger Primer, Criminal Law Anatomy of a Jury Trial, and Estate Planning Law
9973f339-25ef-4f89-bc7d-741872a4908a.name: OCPA 2022 Educational Conference

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

a2af309b-d573-450c-b16b-570d38f00d4f.description: An individual enrolled in any educational program that will lead to employment as a paralegal as defined by Calif. BPC § 6450. May serve on any committee within the Association, or may participate on the board of directors as a student liaison, as appointed by the board of directors. Is entitled to all other benefits of OCPA except voting privileges and is ineligible to hold any office or position voted upon by the general OCPA membership.
a2af309b-d573-450c-b16b-570d38f00d4f.name: OCPA Student Member

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Enrolled students in good standing in any university, college, junior college, or other approved school pursuing a course of study as a paralegal and not currently employed as a paralegal.
OCPA memberships must be renewed annually

0bd759f5-3be6-4ab6-ace0-a53e1be5be67.description: The OCPA Board is elected by Active Voting members. The Board oversees the management of OCPA day to day business affairs, focusing on fulfillment of the organization’s mission and vision.
0bd759f5-3be6-4ab6-ace0-a53e1be5be67.name: OCPA Board of Directors

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Only individuals who are Active Type members of OCPA may qualify to be on the OCPA Board of Directors.
Only individuals who are currently working in the paralegal field may run for office and serve on the OCPA Board of Directors.
Ensure that OCPA’s services and programs address members’ and community needs; and market OCPA’s

4a238ba1-118c-4267-8daa-59efad3834f9.description: OCPA Associate Members encourage and support the role of paralegals and provide a network of support for paralegals in the legal field. An Associate Member does not have voting privileges and may not hold office within the Association. An Associate Member is entitled to serve on any Association Committee and is entitled to all other benefits of the Association.
4a238ba1-118c-4267-8daa-59efad3834f9.name: OCPA Associate Member

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: An Associate Member is (1) a paralegal who has not performed paralegal duties within the previous six months, (2) an attorney, or (3) other legal professional who does not meet the qualifications of Voting Membership, but who is interested in and supports the mission, goals and purposes of OCPA and the paralegal profession.
OCPA memberships must be renewed annually

bd77b58f-c26d-4ae9-92b9-123708163d27.description: Since 2001, OCPA has presented a Lifetime Achievement Award to a deserving paralegal or member of the legal community. Qualified individuals submitted for nomination will considered by the OCPA Lifetime Achievement Award Committee.
bd77b58f-c26d-4ae9-92b9-123708163d27.name: OCPA Lifetime Achievement Award Recipient

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Dedication to the paralegal profession and to the progress of OCPA; contributions to the growth and development of the paralegal profession; and extended community involvement.

f44b1c7b-f40b-4e85-a677-171d43acba5d.description: OCPA offers three scholarship opportunities. The Elizabeth Root Memorial Scholarship and the Rep. John R. Lewis Memorial Scholarship are reviewed by OCPA's scholarship committee. OCPA also funds scholarships through several local paralegal education programs. The scholarships are awarded to paralegals or paralegal students for reimbursement of paralegal education, seminars, meetings, OCPA membership or fees for certifications.
f44b1c7b-f40b-4e85-a677-171d43acba5d.name: OCPA Scholarship Recipient

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Recipients are selected from complete and accurate applications as required for each specific scholarship.
Recipients of both memorial scholarships must be a current OCPA member in good standing. Student scholarship recipients will receive a one-year membership to OCPA as part of their award.

0deb19ec-9fd9-4b24-aa95-0e09abb60880.description: The goal of OCPA's mentor program is to promote professionalism and career development, instill high ethical behavior, and contribute to the success of new paralegals and paralegal students.
0deb19ec-9fd9-4b24-aa95-0e09abb60880.name: OCPA Mentor

issuer.summary: issued by Orange County Paralegal Association (OCPA)

badge_template_activities.title: Member in good standing with OCPA. Paralegal student OR less than three (3) years paralegal experience. Complete required documents and be matched with a Mentor.

Willing to assist a paralegal student or new paralegal by answering questions relating to area(s) of law, or other general paralegal-related questions, including involvement in local, state, and national paralegal associations. Agree to be accessible to protégé on an as-needed basis throughout the year.
